To register for a session or for more information, please contact John Whitt at (608) 266-1665 or email him at john.whitt@heab.state.wi.us., 6340=Next HEAB Training Date: September 21, 2006, 1162=The Monthly Memo August, 2006, 2181=NOTIFICATION LIST Distributed Wednesday afternoon:   August 2, 9, 16, 23 and 30, 1586=NEW TIP REFUND PROCESS As part of the federal Higher Education Reconciliation Act of 2005, the federal LEAP and SLEAP programs have been removed from the federal Return of Title IV Funds (R2T4) requirements, as of July 1, 2006. The TIP Grant is partially funded by the federal LEAP/SLEAP programs, so if LEAP/SLEAP is no longer required to be included in R2T4, then TIP no longer has to be included in R2T4. You should use the same procedure to return TIP funds to HEAB as you do to return your WHEG/WTG or any other state funds.}
textBeforeTable: Please check our Webpage for Notification List and Voucher Processing Schedules. http://www.heab.wi.gov/finaid.html UPDATES - COMMITTED AND SPENT August 30, 2006 August 16, 2006 Wednesday's: Friday, August 4 First 0607 list: AES NOTIFICATION LIST PROCESSING Please remember that we are vouchering whole dollar amounts - round down the first semester, up the second. (Please contact me (Connie) if you have any questions about this.) *** August 22, 2006 August 25, 2006 August 29, 2006 August 8, 2006 August 11, 2006 August 15, 2006 August 18, 2006 Tuesday and Friday: NEW TIP REFUND PROCESS As part of the federal Higher Education Reconciliation Act of 2005, the federal LEAP and SLEAP programs have been removed from the federal Return of Title IV Funds (R2T4) requirements, as of July 1, 2006. The TIP Grant is partially funded by the federal LEAP/SLEAP programs, so if LEAP/SLEAP is no longer required to be included in R2T4, then TIP no longer has to be included in R2T4. You should use the same procedure to return TIP funds to HEAB as you do to return your WHEG/WTG or any other state funds. NOTIFICATION
textAfterTable: ** Tuition Grant - deadline for corrections is NOON for Friday September 8th, 2006. All corrections, additions, residency determinations, changes in EFC, household size, year in school, and professional judgments must be sent to HEAB. The only future adjustment allowed will be those lowering commitment for tuition grant. UPCOMING EVENTS Scheduled HEAB Board Meeting: August 29, 2006 Next HEAB Training Date: September 21, 2006 HEAB conducts one-day training programs for new and continuing financial aid administrators. The training session covers all aspects of the programs administered by HEAB, including: Goals of State Aid; Eligibility for State Aid; The Notification List; The Voucher Process; Return of State Funds; Submitting and Receiving Data to/from HEAB; Overviews of the Individual HEAB Programs The program begins at 10:00 a.m. and ends no later than 3:00 p.m. It is held at the HEAB offices at 131 W. Wilson St, Suite 902, Madison, WI. We have room for up to 6 people at each session. Please let us know if you are coming to training as materials are printed based on the number of people attending. To register for a session or for more information, please contact John Whitt at (608) 266-1665 or email him at john.whitt@heab.state.wi.us.   Please contact me by phone at (608) 264-6181 or by email at connie.hutchison@heab.state.wi.us if you have suggestions, questions or concerns. THANKS!
